intro: Salvia pyrenaica, commonly known as Pyrenean sage, is a perennial herb native to the Pyrenees mountain region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces striking violet-blue flowers in whorls along the upper stems, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, often with a minty aroma. Salvia pyrenaica thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
